verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of king<WH4428> Lemuel<WH3927>, the prophecy<WH4853> that his mother<WH517> taught him<WH3256>.
What<WH1248>, my son? and what<WH1248>, the son of my womb<WH990>? and what<WH1248>, the son of my vows<WH5088>?
Give<WH5414> not your strength<WH2428> unto women<WH802>, nor your ways<WH1870> to that which destroys<WH4229> kings<WH4428>.
It is not for kings<WH4428>, O Lemuel<WH3927>, it is not for kings<WH4428> to drink<WH8354> wine<WH3196>; nor for<WH335> princes<WH7336> strong drink<WH7941>:
Lest they drink<WH8354>, and forget<WH7911> the law<WH2710>, and pervert<WH8138> the judgment<WH1779> of any of the afflicted<WH1121>.
Give<WH5414> strong drink<WH7941> unto him that is ready to perish<WH6>, and wine<WH3196> unto those that be of heavy<WH4751> hearts<WH5315>.
Let him drink<WH8354>, and forget<WH7911> his poverty<WH7389>, and remember<WH2142> his misery no more<WH5999>.
Open<WH6605> your mouth<WH6310> for the mute<WH483> in the cause<WH1779> of all such as are appointed<WH1121> to destruction<WH2475>.
Open<WH6605> your mouth<WH6310>, judge<WH8199> righteously<WH6664>, and plead<WH1777> the cause of the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>.
Who can find<WH4672> a virtuous<WH2428> woman<WH802>? for her price<WH4377> is far<WH7350> above rubies<WH6443>.
The heart<WH3820> of her husband<WH1167> does safely trust<WH982> in her<WH2637>, so that he shall have no need of plunder<WH7998>.
She will do<WH1580> him good<WH2896> and not evil<WH7451> all the days<WH3117> of her life<WH2416>.
She seeks<WH1875> wool<WH6785>, and flax<WH6593>, and works<WH6213> willingly<WH2656> with her hands<WH3709>.
She is like the merchants<WH5503>' ships<WH591>; she brings<WH935> her food<WH3899> from afar<WH4801>.
She rises<WH6965> also while it is yet night<WH3915>, and gives<WH5414> food<WH2964> to her household<WH1004>, and a portion<WH2706> to her maidens<WH5291>.
She considers<WH2161> a field<WH7704>, and buys<WH3947> it<WH6529>: with the fruit of her hands<WH3709> she plants<WH5193> a vineyard<WH3754>.
She puts<WH2296> her body<WH4975> with strength<WH5797>, and strengthens<WH553> her arms<WH2220>.
She perceives<WH2938> that her merchandise<WH5504> is good<WH2896>: her candle<WH5216> goes not out<WH3518> by night<WH3915>.
She lays<WH7971> her hands<WH3027> to the spindle<WH3601>, and her hands<WH3709> hold<WH8551> the distaff<WH6418>.
She stretches out<WH6566> her hand<WH3709> to the poor<WH6041>; Yes<WH7971>, she reaches forth her hands<WH3027> to the needy<WH34>.
She is not afraid<WH3372> of the snow<WH7950> for her household<WH1004>: for all her household<WH1004> are clothed<WH3847> with scarlet<WH8144>.
She makes<WH6213> herself coverings of tapestry<WH4765>; her clothing<WH3830> is silk<WH8336> and purple<WH713>.
Her husband<WH1167> is known<WH3045> in the gates<WH8179>, when he sits<WH3427> among the elders<WH2205> of the land<WH776>.
She makes<WH6213> fine linen<WH5466>, and sells<WH4376> it<WH5414>; and delivers belts<WH2289> unto the merchant<WH3669>.
Strength<WH5797> and honor<WH1926> are her clothing<WH3830>; and she shall rejoice<WH7832> in time<WH3117> to come<WH314>.
She opens<WH6605> her mouth<WH6310> with wisdom<WH2451>; and in her tongue<WH3956> is the law<WH8451> of kindness<WH2617>.
She looks well<WH6822> to the ways<WH1979> of her household<WH1004>, and eats<WH398> not the bread<WH3899> of idleness<WH6104>.
Her sons<WH1121> arise up<WH6965>, and call her blessed<WH833>; her husband<WH1167> also<WH1984>, and he praises her.
Many<WH7227> daughters<WH1323> have done<WH6213> virtuously<WH2428>, but you excel them all<WH5927>.
Favor<WH2580> is deceitful<WH8267>, and beauty<WH3308> is vain<WH1892>: but a woman<WH802> that fears<WH3373> the Lord<WH3068>, she shall be praised<WH1984>.
Give<WH5414> her of the fruit<WH6529> of her hands<WH3027>; and let her own works<WH4639> praise<WH1984> her in the gates<WH8179>.
